definition[0]: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
example[0]: When dawn broke  (=the first light of the day appeared), we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
example[1]: I was up at the crack of dawn  (=very early in the morning) to get the plane.
example[2]: We worked from dawn to dusk  (=through the whole day while it is light).
example[4]: The boats set off at dawn.
definition[1]: if day or morning dawns, it begins
example[5]: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
definition[2]: if a period of time or situation dawns, it begins
example[6]: The age of Darwin had dawned.
definition[3]: if a feeling or idea dawns, you have it for the first time
example[7]: It began to dawn that something was wrong.
